posts.post_title: WTB t206 Red Cobb in either  PSA 1/2 or SGC 10/20 condition
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Jim T
I have to disagree to some extent.  While you might be hard pressed to find a PSA 1 for $350, another 100 bucks and some patience will land you a very presentable Cobb.  I looked for months for a red Cobb in my price range that presented well until I saw one listed with BIN for $550.  I offered the seller $450 and he jumped on it.  Made me wish I had offered a little less but I was still happy with it.

In any case, Jamie, just be patient and hold out until you find a card that you are satisfied with.

posts.post_title: WTB t206 Red Cobb in either  PSA 1/2 or SGC 10/20 condition
posts.post_content:
Posted By: MikePugeda
Jamie,

As you have shown, it is possible to find a Red Cobb in the 350-400 range, but I think more realistically you'll be looking at more like 400-500 for a presentable PSA 1/SGC 10.  I purchased my PSA 1 for around $500, but I thought for the grade it had great eye appeal.  One moderate crease at the right border, no paper loss on back, but very slight discoloration of back (staining?)

[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1213974037.JPG[/IMG] 

Are you opposed to buying one raw?  You might save a little, then have it graded.

Mike
